title: The cDc Compilation - Volume Two
historical_context: This article is part of the early hacker culture, showcasing the works of the Cult of the Dead Cow (cDc), a notable group in the hacking community during the late 1980s.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture history.
short_summary: This article introduces the second volume of the cDc compilation, featuring a collection of files from various authors, aimed at continuing the tradition of sharing knowledge within the hacker community.
summary: In 'The cDc Compilation - Volume Two', Swamp Rat presents a curated collection of files from the Cult of the Dead Cow, highlighting the contributions of various authors in the hacker community. This compilation serves as a testament to the collaborative spirit of the era, encouraging readers to engage with the material and contribute to future volumes. The article emphasizes the importance of knowledge sharing and the ongoing efforts to document the evolving landscape of hacking and phreaking.
summary_details: The compilation includes files #16-30, showcasing a range of topics relevant to the hacker community at the time. Swamp Rat expresses gratitude to contributors and hints at the anticipation for future releases, indicating a commitment to maintaining a quarterly publication schedule. This article not only serves as an introduction to the compilation but also reflects the ethos of the hacker culture in the late 1980s, where collaboration and information exchange were paramount.
